item.title: Report E-2023110449
item.description:
Report E-2023110449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 13, 2023, four (4) 55-pound bags of UN3378 were damaged and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. A HEPA-filtered drum vacuum was used to collect all freestanding product. The undamaged cargo was re-palletized for continued processing and shipping. The damaged bags were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The contents of the vacuum and all UN3378-impacted materials were collected and containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023110448
item.description:
Report E-2023110448

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2920 was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted-trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. EWI placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023110446
item.description:
Report E-2023110446

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 25-pound pail of UN2880 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail of calcium hypochlorite and all the released product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly vented drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110444
item.description:
Report E-2023110444

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1139 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and swept them in utilizing hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On November 8, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a faulty pallet and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263 paint-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged 55-gallon drum was containerized into an 85-gallon over-pack. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum, both for terminal disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbent, the damaged pails, and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: On November 6, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint- impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1824 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. MSES personnel then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in using hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to collect any residual product from the impacted areas. The empty 5-gallon jug, all spent absorbents, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110246
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: HUNTSVILLE
  • State: AL

  • Description: On November 2, 2023, one (1) one-gallon pail of UN3264 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted site. Crews neutralized the impacted surfaces with a sprayer, soda ash solution, and absorbent pads, and they pH tested the surfaces to ensure they were sufficiently neutralized. MEG personnel placed the one (1) impacted 1-gallon pail, used absorbent pads, and any cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon bucket that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: While in transit, a pallet of (UN3265) NALCO DC14 shifted resulting in the caps of (3) Jerricans hitting the pallet/trailer floor and releasing approximately 5-gallons of product. A contractor neutralized the spilled product with Sodium Bicarbonate prior to cleaning up the release. Once the lids were tightened on the (3) Jerricans, they were able to ship on to the intended destination. No storm drains. waterways, or soil were impacted.

  • City: CHICAGO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, two (2) one-gallon cans of UN1263 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews downstacked and repalletized the non-impacted pails of product onto a new pallet. The damaged pails and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110242
item.description:
Report E-2023110242

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1993 were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel collected two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor, concrete and nearby trench drain and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN3265 was punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged 30-gallon drum in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew deployed soda ash to the released material and swept them in using hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was called out leaking in the unload and upon arrival it was discovered as a hazmat. A red hazardous bin layered with absorbent, a clear hazardous materials bag, and another layer of absorbent was used to pick up the package. DescribePack: The outer top flaps of the box were found wet. Upon inner inspection, 3 out of the 4 bottles were found bent from the body and the caps were also loose. The labels on the bottles were also soiled and damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent sheets were used to cover up the top flaps of the box and placed in the red hazardous bin since the leakage didn't spread beyond the box itself. Sheets used were also placed inside the clear hazardous materials bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. was received damaged. Pkg. had liquid leaking from bottom of box, taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting pkg., it was noted that there were 2, 1 gallon containers of Corrosive material, pkg. was not declared a Hazmat by shipper. There were no labels, orientation arrows, hazmat shipping paper work of any type. We noticed it was a Hazmat by looking at the container, has Corrosive label on it. Cans were stacked on top of each other in box, just brown paper to protect contents. We searched to see if shipper was an Authorized Shipper, they are not. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting in bin in HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH. Will reach out to customer to see if they are willing to pick up the undamaged container.

  • City: MAPLE GROVE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED OF A LEAKEING HAZMAT AT BAY 210. UPPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER FOUND A HAZMAT WITH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS LEAKING ON THE FLOOR INFRONT OF THE TRAILER. AFTER CLEANING UP THE LEAKED CONTENTS RESPONDER BROUGHT THE MATERIAL BACK TO THE DMP TO BE PROCESSED. WHILE DISPOSING OF THE MATERIALS IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THERE WERE 4 1GAL CONTAINER WITH PIN HILE VENTED CAPS AND ONE OF THE CAPS WAS MISSING THE PAPER PLUG UNDERNEATH THE CAP ALLOWING THE CONTENTS TO MORE EASILY LEAK OUT OF THE VENTED PIN HOLE.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP AT 3:45 AM, FROM DOOR 38, ON THE UNLOAD. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN, ONE, 1 GALLON METAL CAN, OF ZIP TAC 3 ACCELERATOR, BEING SHIPPED AS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZ-MAT PACKAGE, (UN1219, ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, 3, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 1 GALLON). THE CAP ON THE METAL CANS ALLOWED A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE ALCOHOL SOLUTION TO LEAK ONTO THE OUTER CARTON, THERE WAS NO PACKING MATERIAL IN THE BOX. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

CONTACTED HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR UNDECLARED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1Z3R4A250391055678 AND 1Z3R4A250398107706. INNER BOXES STATE UN3161 WITH CLASS 2.1 FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The manager called it out on the radio a leaking hazmat and that there was a strong odor in the trailer. One of the admins grabbed all the hazmat totes and PPE and went over to check out the damaged hazmat. Discovered three hazmat were on its side in the trailer by station 282. All three of them were not upright by the orientation arrows. They were placed into a red hazardous waste totes and brought over to QA. DescribePack: The caps are vented and since they were found on its side and not upright. It leaked out slowly through the vented cap. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: put all the bottles upright to prevent from leaking.

item.title: Report I-2023110026
item.description:
Report I-2023110026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Univar Solutions Driver went to load a tanker at Associated Asphalt with Caustic Soda 50% at 8:30AM on October 11th. Driver failed to recognize seal on external valve of tanker indicating tanker was filled, and failed to check dome gasket because of visibility. Driver arrived at Associated Asphalt, inputted his load number with specific weights, and popped the dome gasket. Loading then began and once the control arm hit 21,0001bs the tanker began to overfill. Driver hit the stopfill button once he noticed that product was coming over the top, but 25-30 gallons of product was released onto the asphalt. Associated Asphalt workers and driver cleaned up spill with spill pads and sorb-oil. NRC clean up company has been contracted to take care of any leftover product on asphalt ground to prevent any residues flowing to retention pond. No injuries.

  • Description: On October 31, 2023, seven (7) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN1263 impacted impacted dock floor. AS personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pails of product. The damaged pails and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-01
  • City: CUMBERLAND
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/01/2023, at 0431 hours, personnel in the CSXT Cumberland Yard discovered SHQX 51000, a residue tank car of Liquefied Petroleum Gases, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and Maryland Department of the Environment were notified. Specialized Professional Services, Inc., a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the B-End liquid valve and vapor valve partially open and the secondary closure plugs improperly installed resulting in an active release of lading. The issues were identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper, Mr. Derek Campbell of Kiros Energy, phone 403.483.1250. Contractor personnel closed both open valves and properly installed the secondary closure plugs in accordance with 49 CFR 173.31. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 119 NARRI: 90

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the trailer leaking. After clearing everyone out, the manager called for QA to check on package. QA got a red tote to clean up as well as some neutralizer to clear out the liquid that was on the truck. Some packages were affected by the hazmat, a IC package and two sets of tires. QA brought the hazmat, IC, and tires to hazmat cage to process properly. DescribePack: One can was damaged from the bottom of the can. It was noticeable leaking from a hole which damaged the other cans as well. The acid leaked through the box and the whole bottom of the package was gone. The shipper did not pack any inner packing to protect the products from getting damaged unacceptable when shipping out hazmats. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a red tote, put the lid on top of box and transported the hazmat to the hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was tipped over at some point allowing the loose cap to start leaking out. Loader noticed the leaking package and alerted QA. In house clean up. DescribePack: Cap inside was placed on crooked and was not sealed. Once package was tipped, it allowed the loose cap to start leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fiberboard absorbed the liquid. Wrapped in Hazmat bag and placed in salvage drum. Awaiting disposition from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023101354
item.description:
Report X-2023101354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023101354 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX WAS WET AND TORN A LITTLE BIT. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO SAFELY REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THERE WAS 4 BOTTLES OF RAPICDE. TWO OF PART B AND TWO OF PART A. THERE WAS A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE BOTTLES OF PART B AND DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP APPROXIAMTELY 0.5 (1/2) OF A CUP ENDED UP LEAKING OUT CAUSING THE BOX ITSELF TO GET TORN AND WET AS WELL. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN SAFE AND TIMELY MANNER. 2. X-2023101358 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE BOX WAS WET AND TORN ON THE BOTTOM SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER SO I COULD SAFELY REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THERE WERE 4 BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. TWO OF THEM WERE RAPICIDE PART A AND THE OTHER TWO WERE RAPICIDE PART B. ONE OF THAT BOTTLES OF THE PART B SOLUTION HAD A LOOSE CAP WHICH THEN CAUSED IT TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OTHER BOTTLES AND ONTO THE BOX ITSELD. APPROXIAMTELY 1 CUP LEAKED OUT DUE TO THE LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY FASHION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage in a bag with wet conditions. Upon inspection, the box was found falling apart and completely soaked. Wet OP900 ad Packing slip was recovered. 1 of 2 Bottles containing "Noble Low Temp San" was found leaked out about half way. The bottles were placed into a salvage drum to await proper disposition. DescribePack: The package failure seems to be from a loose cap and being dropped or put upside down, causing the bottle to leak out half way. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately inspected to salvage any information and to prevent further leakage. The bottles were then placed upright into a salvage drum to await proper disposition.

RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE SPOT OF THE LEAKER AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE STEPS IN THE DECISION TREE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL.   • Description: The tank car was seen by UPRR yard personnel to be leaking as it was being moved in the Reisor Yard in Shreveport LA. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. Mgr. Robinson called an emergency response contractor, and they got on site before he did. The car was leaking from a misaligned man way gasket and needed to be replaced. The gasket was replaced, and the man way was properly secured and the top and sides of the car wiped down so it could continue in transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023101139
item.description:
Report X-2023101139

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/20/23 at aproximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 563935 to the station location in Irving, reporting an undeclared hazardous substance shipment. The shipment consists for eight fiberboard boxes, each containing one plastic jerrican labeled "Champignon Liquid" from China. The shipment emitted an odor, warranting further investigation. An online sds of a similar product revealed that the commodity is classifed as UN 3082. The shipment was not prepared in accordanace with IATA Regulations, having shipped without the requires markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The complete shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: Diesel fuel was observed leaking from the manway on the VMSX 310119 while at the Balmer railyard on 9/8/23. The car was isolated for inspection. Hazmat responders identified the release as coming from the manway sealing area underneath the cover. Upon inspection it was found that the manway gasket had not been applied resulting in a small release of diesel fuel to the car body. Crews added a gasket and secured the car. Release loss estimates are based upon visual observations of the responders.

item.title: Report I-2023080050
item.description:
Report I-2023080050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-22T00:34:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: CONVERSE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2023 at approximately 1030am a cargo tank trailer returning a rejected shipment of mixed acids from Gleco Plating started to leak on the shoulder of Loop 1604 in Converse Tx. Emergency responders were notified immediately, and US Ecology Emergency Response crews were dispatched from the US Ecology Cibolo Tx location less than 15 minutes away. The TCEQ and NRC were notified of the spill immediately after emergency response reaction. All lanes of Loop 1604 were closed between FM 78 and Lower Seguin Rd, they were re-opened around midnight once the highway was cleaned up. The Emergency Response crew unloaded waste from the tanker into totes until the tanker stopped leaking at which point it was transferred to the US Ecology Cibolo location to be stored within a bermed area for further unloading. All waste is being disposed of properly at an authorized facility and TX DOT has approved of the remediation at the spill site.
